document.masterDocTitle: Review of the genus Scythropiodes Matsumura, 1931 (Lepidoptera, Lecithoceridae, Oditinae) from China, with a checklist of the world

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Review of the genus Scythropiodes Matsumura, 1931 (Lepidoptera, Lecithoceridae, Oditinae) from China, with a checklist of the world

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Depressaria issikii
Takahashi, 1930
: 285
. TL: Japan .
Psecadia ( Ethmia ) issikii (Takahashi)
:
Matsumura, 1931
: 1084
.
Odites plocamopa
Meyrick, 1935 b
: 84
.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. Adult (
Fig. 15
) with wingspan 14.0–23.0 mm. This species is similar to
S. citrantha (Meyrick, 1908 )
by having a similar forewing pattern. It can be separated by the valva narrowed gradually and the transtilla having a pair of semioval lateral lobes (
Fig. 30
). In
S. citrantha
, the valva is broadened semiovally from distal 1 / 3 , and the transtilla has a pair of stout digitate lateral lobes (
Clarke 1955 : Pl. 230 ,
Figs 2 – 2
a
).

Host plants. Caprifoliaceae :
Viburnum odoratissimum
,
Weigela coraeensis
; Rosaceae :
Malus pumila
,
Prunus persica
,
Pyrus ussuriensis
,
Rosa
sp.; Rubiaceae :
Gardenia jasminoides
; Salicaceae :
Populus nigra
,
Salix
sp.; Smilacaceae :
Smilax china
; Ulmaceae :
Ulmus parvifolia
; Vitaceae :
Vitis vinifera
(
Park & Wu 1997
;
Sakamaki 2013
).
Moriuti ( 1982 )
mentioned that this species rolled the leaves of host plants at its larval stage.

Distribution.
China
(Anhui, Beijing, Chongqing, Fujian, Gansu, Guangxi, Guizhou, Hainan, Hebei, Henan, Hubei, Hunan, Jiangxi, Liaoning, Qinghai, Shaanxi, Shanxi, Shandong, Sichuan, Yunnan, Zhejiang), Korea , Japan , Russia .
